result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Initial Scheduling Order
Calendar call on February 22, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Festival Food

8:45 AM Defendant Ronald E. Patten in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for Ronald E. Patten.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance

Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested in Person and scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 8:45. Time limits waived. Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald E. Patten appeared by phone. Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints attorney Joshua Grube. Defendant to reimburse the County $60 per month.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald E. Patten not in court. Court wants noted on the record that defendant was not present at today's hearing. Indigency hearing already scheduled with Judge Hanson on August 18, 2022 at 1:30 PM.
Indigency hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

03:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald E. Patten appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Ronald E. Patten. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $500 Signature Bond with conditions: No contact with Festival Foods. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
